metadata.description: Baseline thresholds and weights for scoring contributions.

thresholds.label: Energy density
thresholds.guideline: WHO encourages limiting energy-dense packaged foods to reduce excess calorie intake.
citations: WHO. Guideline: Policies to protect children from the harmful impact of food marketing. 2023.

thresholds.label: Total sugars
thresholds.guideline: WHO guidance: keep free sugars below 10% of daily energy intake.
citations: WHO. Guideline: Sugars intake for adults and children. 2015.

contexts.label: Beverage threshold
contexts.notes: Applied when beverage heuristics classify the product as a drink.

thresholds.label: Saturated fat
thresholds.guideline: AHA recommends limiting saturated fat to under 6% of daily calories.
citations: AHA. 2021 Dietary Guidance to Improve Cardiovascular Health.

thresholds.label: Sodium
thresholds.guideline: US Dietary Guidelines cap sodium at 2300 mg/day (~460 mg per meal).

contexts.label: Beverage threshold
contexts.notes: Drinks are penalized sooner due to typically lower sodium baselines.

thresholds.label: Fruits/veg/legumes/nuts
thresholds.guideline: Modeled after Nutri-Score produce thresholds for healthy additions.
citations: SantÃ© Publique France. Nutri-Score Scientific Update. 2022.

thresholds.label: Dietary fiber
thresholds.guideline: Adults should average ~28 g of fiber per day; encourages >1 g per 100 g.
citations: FDA. Dietary Reference Intakes for Fiber. 2018.

contexts.label: Beverage threshold
contexts.notes: Smoothies and fortified drinks are rewarded at half-step increments.

thresholds.label: Protein
thresholds.guideline: Aligns with EFSA protein density guidance for satiety support.
citations: EFSA. Dietary Reference Values for protein. 2023.

contexts.label: Hydrating beverage floor
contexts.notes: Hydration guardrail enforces a minimum 5-point bonus when energy and sugar are low.
